definition: Under Australian Federal Law, a woman has the right to breastfeed or express milk anywhere she chooses; under the federal Sex Discrimination Act 1984 it is illegal to discriminate against a person either directly or indirectly on the grounds of breastfeeding.
examples: This includes in fitting rooms or on the shop floor.
If you receive a complaint from a customer you may advise them that this is a women's right under Australian Federal Law.
caveats: No one should ever be asked by a team member to cover themselves or stop breastfeeding or expressing anywhere in our stores.
